Attorney General Eric Holder: s comments about investments in smart-gun technology were misrepresented by Sarah Palin, who claimed that Holder wanted gun owners to wear identifying bracelets.
Holder: s interest in smart guns was driven by President Barack Obama's directive to explore innovative gun safety technologies after the Sandy Hook Elementary School shootings. Holder chaired a meeting with industry leaders and experts to discuss these technologies.
The coverage of Holder: s comments by various media outlets focused on the idea of "gun tracking bracelets," but the technology mentioned by Holder does not track gun owners and does not always require a bracelet.
